title: Work done in moving a charge

content.question: The work done by an external force to move the sphere of charge <math alttext="negative uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> from the initial configuration to the final configuration is <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The sphere with charge of <math alttext="negative uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is then replaced with an identical sphere charge of <math alttext="positive 2 uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. This new sphere is moved from the initial configuration to the final configuration shown. Which of the following expressions is correct for the work done by the external force to move the sphere with charge <math alttext="positive 2 uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, in terms of <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
